result.execSummary:
The defendant Lloyd R Sias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lloyd R Sias

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

10:30 case called. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lloyd R Sias in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State recites offer and Defendant is in agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Court orders court costs, to provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharges. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
CK 44044 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail posted refunded.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone including J.J.

(Cases called at 11:39 am.)  Court Commissioner Wendy Sue Johnson for Branch 4
Defendant appeared without counsel.  State by DDA Angela Beranek.
Defendant. advised of charges and potential penalties.  $650 cash bond posted is Ordered returned.  State requests no contact with victim.  Defendant objects.  Court does not Order the no contact.
Pretrial Conference:  07-13-22 at 1:15 pm.   Hearing:  08-04-22 at 9:30 am.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone including J.J.
